programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: Settling Down But Never Settling
programme.desc: Jessie Fiacco is a single mother and nurse, who during the pandemic made home visits. But Jessie hasn’t made time for herself. Luckily for her, Kinga is in town to show Jessie she doesn’t have to travel far to get far out.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Running on Empty & Finishing with Family
programme.desc: Justin pushes body and mind through seven brutal marathons on seven continents in seven days. From frostbite in Antarctica to his daughter joining him for the final steps in Miami, this is the most intense and inspiring challenge of his life.

programme.title: One Pill Can Kill
programme.desc: Told through the voices of grieving parents, this documentary follows the real and lasting impact of the fentanyl crisis. Capturing the aftermath of sudden loss, the search for answers, and the transformation of grief into public advocacy.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero takes to the streets to quiz people on the wildest, wackiest news stories. In "Unbelievable Adventures," contestants answer questions for cash about a 700 lb. fish, a special cross-country trip and a woman taking on a bear.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.sub-title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nation’s largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand… or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, America’s native spirit.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: America's Goofiest Getaways
programme.desc: From stealing an ambulance after leaving a hospital to hijacking a helicopter for the sake of love, these criminals have odd motives and even odder methods of executing them.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: America's Goofiest Getaways
programme.desc: From stealing an ambulance after leaving a hospital to hijacking a helicopter for the sake of love, these criminals have odd motives and even odder methods of executing them.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: Recreating Salmon Yuca Mash vs. Venezuelan Seafood Empanada
programme.desc: In this battle, it's sink or swim. Chef Josiah of Purple Ocean Superfood Bar in Waterford Lakes takes on Chef Daniel of The Moderne in the Mills 50 district. We’ve got a seafood extravaganza on this episode of Blind Kitchen.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.sub-title: Eat Play Stay: On a Roll in Jim Thorpe, PA
programme.desc: Fall in love with this camera-ready town nicknamed Little Switzerland. Ride in a sidecar, go to work in a coal mine and pick up some donuts along the way. Stay the night in an inspiring haunted mansion.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.sub-title: Sports Town Stories: Sactown Athletes Inspire Community
programme.desc: A taekwondo master on a mission to empower women, a high school football star making his family proud, and a soccer club smashing stereotypes personify the best of Sacramento.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Brazen Heists You Won't Believe
programme.desc: Heists that are so bold, brazen and audacious you have to see them to believe them. But in the world of crime, audacity doesn’t always pay.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Rebuilding after Hurricane Maria
programme.desc: In the wake of Hurricane Maria's destruction in Puerto Rico, Justin and Ryan fly down to help communities rebuild and help families any way they can.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.sub-title: Local Love: Bold Blogger Dueling It Out For Love
programme.desc: Lifestyle blogger Morgan is ready to find her special someone. Three Des Moines bachelors try to capture her heart one date at a time. Will it be by getting creative, using a good offense or will she roll into love on wheels?

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.sub-title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown: Treat Yo-Self
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie invite you along for a fabulous day of decadence and pampering at some of their favorite “treat yo-self” spots in Sactown.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate it, Pittsburgh!: Between The Bread
programme.desc: In honor of Pittsburgh's love of handhelds, Chef Claudy Pierre and Chef Alex Brown get creative crafting their best sandwich-inspired dishes.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.sub-title: Boston Rob Does Beantown: Fancy in Back Bay
programme.desc: Rob discovers amazing antiques, grills some top-notch steak, tours an animal shelter and serves drinks in one of Boston’s poshest neighborhoods.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Take a trip to see some unique destinations across the country.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero takes to the streets to ask people about the wildest, wackiest news stories. In "Odd Jobs," contestants learn about a kid-run food truck, a school board member with a special license and a senior citizen that's into heavy work.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.sub-title: Weathering the Storm: Couple Faces Historic Tornado on Eve of Wedding
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: WGAL Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest local news and weather from WGAL.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Running on Empty & Finishing with Family
programme.desc: Justin pushes body and mind through seven brutal marathons on seven continents in seven days. From frostbite in Antarctica to his daughter joining him for the final steps in Miami, this is the most intense and inspiring challenge of his life.

programme.title: One Pill Can Kill
programme.desc: Told through the voices of grieving parents, this documentary follows the real and lasting impact of the fentanyl crisis. Capturing the aftermath of sudden loss, the search for answers, and the transformation of grief into public advocacy.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Orlando expert, Brendan O'Connor, celebrates the people behind the scenes of the businesses that make Orlando a truly unique place. Join him as he rolls up his sleeves and receives hands on training while spending a day with them, On The Job.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: Shift: The Ragbrai Documentary
programme.desc: A celebration of the oldest, largest, and longest recreational touring bicycle ride in the world. Three riders and a pair of community leaders reach new personal heights, changing their lives along the seven day ride across Iowa.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: From professional hockey players to award-winning muralists, The Spark highlights the craft, the journey, and the joy. These masters and thought leaders may have made names for themselves on the national stage, but they never forget the city that sparks their inspiration daily

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Running on Empty & Finishing with Family
programme.desc: Justin pushes body and mind through seven brutal marathons on seven continents in seven days. From frostbite in Antarctica to his daughter joining him for the final steps in Miami, this is the most intense and inspiring challenge of his life.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.sub-title: My Perfect Day with Woman's Day: Kind-Hearted 10-year-old Gets Showered With Thanks
programme.desc: Catalina, a 10-year-old community hero with a heart of gold spends her days giving back. Today, Meaghan surprises Catalina with a day of her own, from Sea adventures to a new set of wheels and more. It's her time to shine.

programme.title: Behind the Lens: A Storytellers Project
programme.desc: Join WGAL News 8's Anne Shannon for "Behind the Lens: A Storytellers Project," where we relive the best of 2024 through the eyes of our award-winning photojournalists.

programme.title: Game On: Fight for the Kings
programme.desc: Game On: Fight for the Kings is a KCRA 3 documentary with never-before-heard stories of the four-month fight, the friendships garnered between the rival cities, and Sacramento doing the unimaginable: winning the battle for the Kings.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Botched Crimes
programme.desc: Sometimes, would-be criminals are their own worst enemies. This episode highlights crime “fails,” and the officers - and ordinary civilians - who save the day.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.sub-title: Heroes On Call: The Forgotten Story of America's First Paramedics
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.
